name: RhythMIR
tagline: Digital Music Information Retrieval for Computer Games
body:
# What is RhythMIR?
RhythMIR is a project by [Craig Jeffrey](http://craigjeffrey.net/) which uses techniques of [Music Information Retrieval](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Music_information_retrieval) to generate metadata files for music tracks. RhythMIR is also a simple rhythm game with gameplay generated from these metadata files.
RhythMIR is currently in development as Craig's Honours Project for the last year of [Computer Games Technology at Abertay University](http://www.abertay.ac.uk/studying/ug/comopgamestech/).

## Quick Install
This will be written when the project is done :] - Craig, 20th February 2016

### Copyright/License
This has not yet been decided. The university has allowed me to open source the code on github but a discussion of license has not occurred. This will be decided when the project is done. Until then, please be aware that the default license is All Rights Reserved. [Source](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4007674/whats-the-default-license-of-code-published-at-github) - Craig, 20th February 2016
